dmca.title: ATTN: Peter Pathos - PP46-ARIN

To Whom It May Concern: Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA"). Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim. Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/about_us/legal_docs/ThePlanet%20Copyright%20Infringeme nt%2001%2015%2007%20FINAL.pdf Legal Response Team THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC. -----Original Message----- From: webmaster@asylum-et.com [mailto:webmaster@asylum-et.com] Sent: Monday, March 05, 2007 1:21 AM To: Copyright Subject: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3329937R] [Fwd: [ADMINS] ATTN: Peter Pathos - PP46-ARIN] ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== 1. [Fwd: [ADMINS] ATTN: Peter Pathos - PP46-ARIN] Added by system at Monday, Mar 5 2007 06:54 am X-MailFrom: cnewcomb@theplanet.com X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net Received: from [216.12.192.67] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for ; Mon Mar 5 06:54:02 2007 Received: (qmail 27689 invoked by alias); 5 Mar 2007 12:54:02 -0000 Delivered-To: abuse@inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net Received: (qmail 27680 invoked from network); 5 Mar 2007 12:54:01 -0000 Received: from smtp02.theplanet.com (70.87.6.111) by inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net with SMTP; 5 Mar 2007 12:54:01 -0000 Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp02.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Mon, 5 Mar 2007 06:54:01 -0600 Return-path: Delivery-date: Mon, 05 Mar 2007 06:54:01 -0600 Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181] helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from cnewcomb@theplanet.com) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1HOChV-00068y-2t for abuse@theplanet.com; Mon, 05 Mar 2007 06:54:01 -0600 Received: from abuse.ev1servers.net ([216.127.76.85]) by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from cnewcomb@theplanet.com) with smtp (Exim) id 1HOChT-000Cjf-1X for abuse@theplanet.com; Mon, 05 Mar 2007 06:53:59 -0600 Received: (qmail 29779 invoked from network); 5 Mar 2007 12:53:57 -0000 Received: from spyglass.hstntx1.theplanet.com (HELO ?127.0.0.1?) Sun, 04 Mar 2007 21:46:35 -0800 From: To: Date: Mon, 5 Mar 2007 00:46:40 -0500 Message-ID: MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----=_NextPart_000_000C_01C75EBF.BD1457E0" X-Priority: 3 (Normal) X-MSMail-Priority: Normal X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook IMO, Build 9.0.2416 (9.0.2910.0) X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2900.3028 Importance: Normal X-AntiAbuse: This header was added to track abuse, please include it with any abuse report X-AntiAbuse: Primary Hostname - cappela.lunarpages.com X-AntiAbuse: Original Domain - theplanet.com X-AntiAbuse: Originator/Caller UID/GID - [47 12] / [47 12] X-AntiAbuse: Sender Address Domain - asylum-et.com X-Source: X-Source-Args: X-Source-Dir: X-Spam-Level: - X-Spam-Score: -1.6 Subject: [ADMINS] ATTN: Peter Pathos - PP46-ARIN X-BeenThere: planetadmins@lists.theplanet.com X-Mailman-Version: 2.1.7 Precedence: list Reply-To: webmaster@asylum-et.com List-Id: The Planet Admins list List-Unsubscribe: , List-Archive: List-Post: List-Help: List-Subscribe: , Sender: planetadmins-bounces@lists.theplanet.com Errors-To: planetadmins-bounces@lists.theplanet.com X-OriginalArrivalTime: 05 Mar 2007 05:47:16.0044 (UTC) FILETIME=[BAF640C0:01C75EE9] (multipart/alternative) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. MIME element (text/plain) Dear Peter Pathos, I am contacting you in regard to websites hosted by hostgator and or theplanet. My take is hostgator is a reseller for theplanet. These websites have been stealing copy written content from our website. We have made efforts costing us hundreds of dollars to stop them from stealing the content. It is clearly stated on our website that all content is copy written. Use of our content is only permitted as a partial output not full pages or posts and only with links back to us. We have tried to find ways to contact the owners of this rather large ring of websites that resolve as www.agents*.info where the * is a range of numbers that are changed. This is some info that may help you. ip: 70.87.239.66 host: gator223.hostgator.com This is an address at which you can find a post with one or more of these sites named in it as content thieves. http://www.agents12.info/blog_asylum_et.htm Our site is located at www.asylum-et.com These sites are clearly not in any way legit. We have a few options from this point forth. You could contact them and they either remove any content related to our site or they provide it as we allow. There is no exception to this unless they directly pay us for the content. As of this moment the total value for the amount of content they posses of ours is yet to be determined. Ballpark from what we have found already minimum of $1000.00 plus loss in revenues. The only other options we have is either we "Asylum-ET" file federal suit against them in accordance with the DMCA or we have come up with another idea that even though it will cost us in having to remove adds we run and block search engines from our site for a short amount of time. We will feed the worst filthy nastiest posts you can imagine through our site to be picked up by these sites resulting in them being banned from every search engine and violate all the add TOS agreements so they may no longer use google adsence or any other like it. That is not something we would prefer to do but our users will get a kick out of it really so it is no skin off our backs except a few loss adds. So if there is nothing you can do and these guys do not do something to remedy this situation we will have no other choice. Overall I think that now you are aware of this situation we will see some resolution rather swiftly. Thank you for your time in reviewing my email and I hope to be hearing from you soon. Please contact me back either by phone or email at your earliest convenience. Thank you, Brian Shaw, www.asylum-et.com webmaster@asylum-et.com (802) 353-0372 MIME element (text/html)

Dear Peter Pathos,

 

I am contacting you in regard to websites hosted by hostgator and or theplanet. My take is hostgator is a reseller for theplanet. These websites have been stealing copy written content from our website. We have made efforts costing us hundreds of dollars to stop them from stealing the content. It is clearly stated on our website that all content is copy written.

 

Use of our content is only permitted as a partial output not full pages or posts and only with links back to us. We have tried to find ways to contact the owners of this rather large ring of websites that resolve as www.agents*.info where the * is a range of numbers that are changed. This is some info that may help you.

ip: 70.87.239.66 host: gator223.hostgator.com

 

This is an address at which you can find a post with one or more of these sites named in it as content thieves. http://www.agents12.info/blog_asylum_et.htm

Our site is located at www.asylum-et.com

 

These sites are clearly not in any way legit. We have a few options from this point forth. You could contact them and they either remove any content related to our site or they provide it as we allow. There is no exception to this unless they directly pay us for the content. As of this moment the total value for the amount of content they posses of ours is yet to be determined. Ballpark from what we have found already minimum of $1000.00 plus loss in revenues.

 

The only other options we have is either we "Asylum-ET" file federal suit against them in accordance with the DMCA or we have come up with another idea that even though it will cost us in having to remove adds we run and block search engines from our site for a short amount of time. We will feed the worst filthy nastiest posts you can imagine through our site to be picked up by these sites resulting in them being banned from every search engine and violate all the add TOS agreements so they may no longer use google adsence or any other like it.

 

That is not something we would prefer to do but our users will get a kick out of it really so it is no skin off our backs except a few loss adds. So if there is nothing you can do and these guys do not do something to remedy this situation we will have no other choice. Overall I think that now you are aware of this situation we will see some resolution rather swiftly. Thank you for your time in reviewing my email and I hope to be hearing from you soon. Please contact me back either by phone or email at your earliest convenience.

 

Thank you,

Brian Shaw,

www.asylum-et.com

webmaster@asylum-et.com

(802) 353-0372
